text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly distinguishes between the evidence rules of the three jurisdictions as required by the criterion. Specifically, it notes that the UK limits disclosure to documents relied upon (*CPR 31*), Germany relies on court-controlled evidence gathering with no party-driven discovery (*ZPO \u00a7142*), and California allows extensive e-discovery (*FRCP 26* / *CCP \u00a72031.010 et seq.*). This directly addresses the core requirement of distinguishing evidence rules.", "criterion_id": "ca0097fe-6cb1-457f-925b-1a1e4893f212"}
